title.narrative: Flood Protection, Water And Sanitation And Livelihoods For Returnees And Idps In South Sudan

description.narrative:
The goal of this project is to contribute towards improved living conditions of IDPs, returnees and urban poor in South Sudan.The specific objectives of this proposed project are:
- Improved flood resilience of selected locations in bomas Alel Chok and Katigiri
- Improved access to clean water and sanitation in the two selected locations
- Improved livelihoods in the two selected settlements.

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

title.narrative: Improved resilience to flooding (protected houses, reduced health risks, protected agricultural fields and reduced crop loss) of IDP, returnee and host population through improved flood protection in the two targeted project locations

description.narrative: Improved resilience to flooding (protected houses, reduced health risks, protected agricultural fields and reduced crop loss) of IDP, returnee and host population through improved flood protection in the two targeted project locations

title.narrative: Number of topographical and hydrological surveys and produce studies to inform designs of the planned intervention in two targeted locations.

title.narrative: Increased access to basic water supply and sanitation of IDP, returnee and host community population in the two targeted project locations

title.narrative: Number of piped water supply systems planned and constructed, each comprising solar powered deep motorized wells, water pipelines, elevated water tanks and communal water points
